page.title: 09CHINA FARM / LARTON LIVERY
page.content:
{CHINA FARM}is also known as 'China Plate Lodge' from the Wedgwood plate presented by the Crown in recognition of help during wars with France. The original plate is in the Liverpool Museum, the replica is mounted on the front of the 500 year old farm building. This dairy farm has 120 Friesian cows milked 3 times daily. The milk is processed at Ledsham. Sown grasses are cut for silage for winter feed.
{LARTON LIVERY FARM}is one of many establishments catering for horse riding in the Wirral. The farm concentrates on livery and riding lessons are given. The 22 acres are used for grazing, stabling and the growing of sown grasses for hay for winter feed.
